item.title: Ruth add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I am selfish, private and easily bored. Will this be a problem?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Augustine Birrell
item.description: "Good as it is to inherit a library, it is better to collect one." -- Augustine Birrell

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "So, this is my life. And I want you to know that I am both happy and sad and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ruth add a quote by P. J. O'Rourke
item.description: "Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it." -- P. J. O'Rourke

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ruth add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Ruth add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Laurie R. King
item.description: "I was fifteen when I first met Sherlock Holmes, fifteen years old with my nose in a book as I walked the Sussex Downs, and nearly stepped on him. In my defense I must say it was an engrossing book, and it was very rare to come across another person in that particular part of the world in that war year of 1915." -- Laurie R. King

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Mignon McLaughlin
item.description: "Every society honors its live conformists and its dead troublemakers." -- Mignon McLaughlin

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Mignon McLaughlin
item.description: "We sometimes feel that we have been really understood, but it was always long ago, by someone now dead." -- Mignon McLaughlin

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "The hours between eight in the evening and one or two in the morning have always been my magic hours. Against the blue candlewick bedspread the white pages of my open book, illuminated by a circle of lamplight, were the gateway to another world." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "Excellent!" I cried. "Elementary," said he." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself; but talent instantly recognizes genius." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "I am an omnivorous reader with a strangely retentive memory for trifles." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "Watson. Come at once if convenient. If inconvenient, come all the same." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen." -- George Orwell

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "You see, but you do not observe." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "There are always some lunatics about. It would be a dull world without them." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It may be that you are not yourself luminous, but that you are a conductor of light. Some people without possessing genius have a remarkable power of stimulating it." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "Now is the dramatic moment of fate, Watson, when you hear a step upon the stair which is walking into your life, and you know not whether for good or ill." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Daniel D. Victor
item.description: "Each of us, I think, adopts a comfortable and familiar era or place in which to plant ourselves; and from then on, that which disagrees with our memories -- a new building here, a change in paint there -- is forever jarring and anachronistic." -- Daniel D. Victor

item.title: Ruth add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman
